sen.j: 京洛劇場（きょうらくげきじょう）は、かつて京都市中京区新京極通六角東入ル松ヶ枝町に存在した演芸場。
sen.e: Kyoraku Theater was an entertainment hall that existed in Matsugae-cho, Rokkaku-higashi-iru, Shinkyogoku, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Kyoraku Theater was an entertainment hall that existed in Matsugae-cho, Rokkaku-higashi-iru, Shinkyogoku, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Kyoraku Theater was an entertainment hall that existed in Matsugae-cho, Rokkaku Higashi-iru, Shinkyogoku Street, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 指示書に合わせました。

sen.j: 千土地興行（後の日本ドリーム観光）経営。
sen.e: It was managed by Sentochi Kogyo (later, Nippon Dream Kanko).
It was managed by Sentochi Kogyo (later, Nippon Dream Kanko).
It was managed by Sentochi Kogyo (later, Nippon Dream Kanko).

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 元来は映画館。
sen.e: Originally, it was a movie theater.
Originally, it was a movie theater.
Originally, it was a movie theater.

sen.j: 京都・新京極の六角通にあった劇場。
sen.e: It was located at Rokkaku-dori, Shinkyogoku.
It was located at Rokkaku-dori, Shinkyogoku.
It was located at Rokkaku-dori Street, Shinkyogoku, Kyoto.

sen.j: 1939年4月6日松竹系の京洛映画劇場として開場。
sen.e: The theater opened on April 6, 1939 as Kyoraku Movie Theater affiliated with Shochiku Company.
The theater opened on April 6, 1939 as Kyoraku Movie Theater affiliated with Shochiku Company.
The theater opened on April 6, 1939 as Kyoraku Movie Theater affiliated with Shochiku Company.

sen.j: ニュース映画や文化映画などの興行を主体にしながら、アイドホールを用いた擬似テレビジョン公演なども行った。
sen.e: Although news films and cultural films were mainly screened at this theater, pseud-television show using Eidophor was also played.
Although news films and cultural films were mainly screened at this theater, pseud-television show using Eidophor was also played.
Although news films and cultural films were mainly screened at this theater, pseudo-television show using Eidophor was also played.

sen.j: 戦後、邦画の二番館となっていたが、1958年5月1日演芸場に改装。
sen.e: It became a theater for secondhand Japanese films after the World War, but it was converted into an entertainment hall on May 1, 1958.
It became a theater for secondhand Japanese films after the World War, but it was converted into an entertainment hall on May 1, 1958.
It became a theater for secondhand Japanese films after the World War Ⅱ, but it was converted into an entertainment hall on May 1, 1958.

sen.j: 「寄席の京洛劇場」と銘打ち、開場前には前夜祭が催された。
sen.e: The event titled "Kyoraku Theater becomes Yose (storyteller theater)" was held on the eve of its opening.
The event titled "Kyoraku Theater becomes Yose (storyteller theater)" was held on the eve of its opening.
The event titled 'Kyoraku Theater becomes Yose (storyteller theater)' was held on the eve of its opening.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 同時期、新京極には富貴 (寄席)新京極の富貴があり、京都随一の寄席として盛業していた。
sen.e: Around that time, Fuki (Yose) of Fuki Shinkyogoku was located in Shinkyogoku and it prospered as a leading Yose in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Around that time, Fuki (Yose) of Fuki Shinkyogoku was located in Shinkyogoku and it prospered as a leading Yose in Kyoto.
Around that time, Fuki (Yose) of Fuki Shinkyogoku was located in Shinkyogoku and it prospered as a leading Yose in Kyoto.

sen.j: しかし、京洛劇場の登場により競合する事態となった。
sen.e: After the birth of Kyoraku Theater, however, two theaters were in rivalry.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: After the birth of Kyoraku Theater, however, the two theaters became rivals.
After the birth of Kyoraku Theater, however, the two theaters became rivals.

sen.j: 富貴は新生プロダクション（現在の松竹芸能の母体の一つ）などから芸人を調達していたが、当時売れっ子が多かった千土地興行所属の芸人はすべて京洛劇場に出演した。
sen.e: While Fuki used entertainers belonging to Shinsei Production (one of origins of current Shochiku Geino Co., Ltd), all entertainers belonging to Sentochi Kogyo, many of them were quite popular at the time, performed at Kyoraku Theater.

While Fuki used entertainers belonging to Shinsei Production (one of origins of current Shochiku Geino Co., Ltd), all entertainers belonging to Sentochi Kogyo, many of them were quite popular at the time, performed at Kyoraku Theater.

While Fuki used entertainers belonging to Shinsei Production (one of origins of current Shochiku Geino Co., Ltd), all entertainers belonging to Sentochi Kogyo, many of them were quite popular at the time, performed at Kyoraku Theater.

sen.j: この結果番組面で劣った富貴は競争に負け、ストリップ劇場に転向してしまった。
sen.e: As a result, Fuki was defeated in the competition because of its poor programs, and it was converted into a strip theater.
As a result, Fuki was defeated in the competition because of its poor programs, and it was converted into a strip theater.
As a result, Fuki was defeated in the competition because of its poor programs, and it was converted into a strip club.

sen.j: しかし、同年12月1日に千日劇場が開場した翌年の1959年1月28日で演芸興行を打ち切り、翌2月から映画館に再度転向した。
sen.e: After Sennichi Theater opened on December 1 in the same year, Kyoraku theater brought entertainment performance into an end as of January 28, 1959, the following year, and again became a movie theater from February.

After Sennichi Theater opened on December 1 in the same year, Kyoraku theater brought entertainment performance to an end as of January 28, 1959, the following year, and again became a movie theater from February.

After Sennichi Theater opened on December 1 in the same year, Kyoraku theater brought entertainment performance to an end as of January 28, 1959, the following year, and again became a movie theater from February in the following year.

sen.j: 千土地が演芸を千日劇場へ集約したことによるものだった。
sen.e: The reason for the above was that Sentochi concentrated entertainment business in Sennichi Theater.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The reason was that Sentochi concentrated on the entertainment business in the Sennichi Theater.
The reason was that Sentochi concentrated on the entertainment business in the Sennichi Theater.

sen.j: 鳴り物入りで開業した割には寄席として営業した期間は短期間であった。
sen.e: In spite of its opening with great fanfare, it operated as Yose for a short period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In spite of its opening with great fanfare, it operated as Yose for a short period.
In spite of its opening with great fanfare, it operated as Yose for a short period.

sen.j: その前月半ばには富貴も演芸から撤退しているため、以降京都市内における演芸場は1962年6月の吉本興業による京都花月劇場の復活まで待たなければならない。
sen.e: Since Fuki withdrew from entertainment business in the middle of the previous month, there was no entertainment hall until June 1962 when Yoshimoto Kogyo Co., Ltd. revived Kyoto Kagetsu Theater.

Since Fuki withdrew from the entertainment business in the middle of the previous month, there was no entertainment hall until June 1962 when Yoshimoto Kogyo Co., Ltd. revived the Kyoto Kagetsu Theater.

Since Fuki withdrew from the entertainment business in the middle of the previous month, there was no entertainment hall in Kyoto City until June 1962 when Yoshimoto Kogyo Co., Ltd. revived the Kyoto Kagetsu Theater.

sen.j: 京洛劇場は邦画の二番館や東映封切館、洋画封切館、名画座として興行を続けたが、1967年1月一杯で閉鎖。
sen.e: Kyoraku Theater continued its operation as a theater for secondhand Japanese films, new films of Toei, new western films or classic films, but it ceased operation as of the end of January 1967.
Kyoraku Theater continued its operation as a theater for secondhand Japanese films, new films of Toei, new western films or classic films, but it ceased operations as of the end of January 1967.
Kyoraku Theater continued its operation as a theater for secondhand Japanese films, new films of Toei, new western films or classic films, but it ceased operations as of the end of January 1967.

sen.j: キャバレー「ナイトサロン花束」に転換された。
sen.e: Thereafter, it was converted into a cabaret "Night Salon Hanataba".
Thereafter, it was converted into a cabaret "Night Salon Hanataba."
Thereafter, it was converted into a cabaret 'Night Salon Hanataba' (bouquet flowers).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: しかし、1969年10月から1年間は東映封切館であった京都劇場が改築工事のため一時閉館したことに伴い、その代替劇場として復活していた。
sen.e: However, it operated as a movie theater for one year from October 1968 during which Kyoto Theater, a theater for new films of Toei, was temporarily closed for renovation.
However, it operated as a movie theater for one year from October 1968 during which Kyoto Theater, a theater for new films of Toei, was temporarily closed for renovation.
However, it operated as a movie theater for one year from October 1969 during which Kyoto Theater, a theater for new films of Toei, was temporarily closed for renovation.

sen.j: その後再度キャバレー「ミニミニサロン・マンゴー」になったが80年代半ばにに廃業して建物は取り壊された。
sen.e: Thereafter, it again became a cabaret "Mini-Mini Salon Mango", but it ceased operation in the middle of 1980's and the building was demolished.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Thereafter, it again became a cabaret "Mini-Mini Salon Mango," but it ceased operation in the middle of 1980's and the building was demolished.
Thereafter, it again became a cabaret 'Mini-Mini Salon Mango,' but it ceased operation in the middle of 1980's and the building was demolished.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 第三者の手に渡り駐車場となった後、飲食店をメインにしたテナントビルが建った。
sen.e: The land was sold to a third person and used as a parking space, and eventually a building with space to rent mainly for restaurants was constructed there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The land was sold to a third person and used as a parking space, and eventually a building with space to rent mainly for restaurants was constructed there.
The land was sold to a third person and used as a parking space, and eventually a building with space to rent mainly for restaurants was constructed there.
